Package academy.mindswap.board

Class Board

java.lang.Object
academy.mindswap.board.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class Board extends Object implements ActionListener
Class representing the board and implements the ActionListener interface.

      public Board()

  • Method Details

    • createBoard

      public void createBoard()
      Call all methods to initialize the game board. Starts with the board frame. Opens a screen splash before the board display. Both boards start with disabled buttons (until a player is chosen). Instantiates a new thread that stays constantly updating the game state and disables all clicked buttons.

    • disableClickedButtons

      private void disableClickedButtons()
      Disables all the clicked buttons.

    • boardFrame

      private void boardFrame()
      Exit on close option. Sets the size of the board and its features.

    • gameIntro

      private void gameIntro()
      Creates screen splash and its features.

    • boardTitle

      private void boardTitle()
      Creates board title bar and his styles.

    • buttonsGrid

      private void buttonsGrid()
      Creates a 3x3 grid. Adds the grid to the frame. Fills the grid with the buttons.

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
      Verifies which button was clicked, gets its index plus one and saves that value as a string in the playerMove variable.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - the event to be processed

    • enableButtons

      public void enableButtons()
      Enables all buttons that weren't clicked.

    • disableButtons

      public void disableButtons()
      Disables all buttons.

    • printWinnerPositions

      private void printWinnerPositions(int a, int b, int c)
      When the winning conditions are fulfilled the winner positions turn green.
      Parameters:
      a - first winner position.
      b - second winner position.
      c - third winner position.

    • getPlayerMove

      public String getPlayerMove()

    • setPlayerTurn

      public void setPlayerTurn(String playerTurn)

    • setPlayerMove

      public void setPlayerMove(String playerMove)

    • setGameState

      public void setGameState(String[][] gameState)

    • setGameResult

      public void setGameResult(String gameResult)
      When the game ends, disable all buttons. If it's not a draw, extracts the winner positions from a message sent by the game. Afterwards, calls the printWinnerPositions method to assign its winning colors. It prints the winner name in the title bar. In case of a draw, turns all buttons yellow and, also, prints DRAW to the title bar.
      Parameters:
      gameResult -
